loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Doña Erminia tiene 52 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos, agricultora, ama de casa y comerciante ya que tiene una pequeña pulpería con la contribuye al ingreso económico en su hogar la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos que llegan a la zona, con un grado de educación primario completo. En compañía de su esposo el cual es agricultor trabajan la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol el cual es propio y agradecen a DIOS por tener una tierra en la cual puedan cultivar lo propio y obtener las ganancias netas. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando ya que en tiempo son aproximadamente 15 minutos. 
Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café con los cuales busca obtener una mejor cosecha y asegurar el producto final de plagas y bichos.
Los planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café ya que de esta forma ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos con la agricultura y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y demás necesidades que se presenten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Erminia is 52, a mother of three, a farmer, a housewife and a shopkeeper, since she has a small neighbourhood grocery store that she uses to contribute to the family income. The shop is located inside her house and her customers are her neighbours and friends who come to the area. She is educated up to primary level. Erminia and her husband, who is a farmer, work the land growing coffee, maize and beans. They thank God because they have their own land to cultivate their crops and earn a net profit. Their crops are located near the house about 15 minutes’ walk away. 

Erminia has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy agricultural materials to grow maize, beans and coffee. This will enable her to obtain a better harvest and assure a final product that is free from pests and vermin. Future plans are to be able to grow a better variety of coffee. In this way she can improve her income through agriculture and continue to support her children in their studies and to cover any other needs they might have in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help grow maize, beans and coffee.

loans.name: Agnaldo

texts.en:
Agnaldo, 33, came to Sorocaba 12 years ago and began to shine shoes to help his family. He stayed for 10 years in this profession until he met a client who helped him find work as a driver in his company. He learned to drive a truck and still works in this field. At age 18 he married Alessandra, they have a daughter who is now 11 years old, and a stepson who is 20 years old. His wife works as a housemaid and sells clothes. Agnaldo always liked cars, and to supplement the family income he began buying beat up old cars and motorcycles with problems, which he refurbishes and resells. He will use this loan to buy a car and motorcycle to repair and resell.

He has borrowed from Banco Pérola before and has an excellent track record with the institution, with no late payment installments, and he has shown himself to be very devoted during the monitoring process. He has an entrepreneurial spirit and is a great seller.

loans.use: to buy a car and motorcycle to repair and resell

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste tem 55 anos de idade,é solteira e mãe de 06 filhos dos quais  01 é que esta a estudar. Ela trabalha todo o dia vendendo productos alimentares básicos.
Ela precisa do empréstimo para comprar cebola, pimenta, palone epatas de galinhas para revender.
 Seu maior sonho é de terminar a sua casa de forma a melhorar as condicões de habitação dos seus filhos e netos.
 O seu desafio é de pagar escola do seu sobrinho que é orfão de pais.
texts.en:
Celeste is 55 years old and single. She has six children, one of whom studies. She works all day long selling basic foodstuffs.
She needs the loan in order to purchase onions, peppers, bologna and chicken feet for re-selling.
Her biggest dream is finishing her house so she can improve her children's and grandchildren's living conditions.
Her biggest challenge is paying for school fees for her nephew, who has lost his parents.

loans.use: to purchase onions, peppers, bologna and chicken feet.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a married woman coming from the village of Silano, in Zamboanga del Norte. She lives with her six children. 

To take care of her family's everyday needs, Rosalita was engaged in a buy and sell business selling charcoal in the market. As their needs are growing day by day, Rosalita must improve her business to more effectively meet the family's requirements. A loan of PHP 10,000 will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase grocery goods to restock her general store. She took a loan from GDMPC which she had recently joined. 

In the future, Rosalita wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to restock her general store.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Joaquin, tengo 64 años soy casado, tengo 3 hijos y me dedico al comercio desde hace 35 años. Primero le ayudaba a mi hermana, pero después ella me vendió su plaza, y desde hace 35 años me hice independiente, mi esposa me ayuda en el negocio que esta dentro de un tianguis. Trabajamos de lunes a sábado. 
Voy a utilizar el préstamo para comprar cobertores, cortinas, y artículos de Navidad
En el negocio vendemos cortinas, cobertores, fundas para baño, artículos de cocina, toallas, blancos en general
Mis principales logros son comprar mi casa, darle educación de mis hijos y lograr una estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Joaquin is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story:

“My name is Joaquin.  I am 64 years old, married, and have three children.  I have been working in commerce for 35 years.  First, I helped my sister.  However, she later sold me her space.  I became independent 35 years ago.  My wife helps me in the business, which is in a market.  We work from Monday through Saturday.

I am going to use the loan to buy bedspreads, curtains, and Christmas items.  In the business we sell curtains, bedspreads, covers for the bathroom, kitchen items, towels, and general bedding.

My main accomplishments are buying my house, giving my children an education, and achieving financial stability.”

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, curtains, and Christmas items.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Olinda tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 04 filhos que estão a estudar. Ela trabalha como professora numa Escola primaria perto de sua casa.
Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar cimento, area, pedra e ferros para a construção da sua casa.
 Seu maior sonho é de terminar a sua casa e  o ensino superior, porém tem o desafio de estudar mais de forma a terminar o curso dentro do período estabelecido
texts.en:
Olinda is 47 years old and married. She has four children who are students. She works as a teacher at an elementary school near her home.
She'll use the loan to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron in order to build her house.
Her biggest dream is to finish her house and graduate from college. However, she faces the challenge is studying more so she can finish the course within the scheduled time frame.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina is 60 years old. She is married and lives at Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes care of and maintains a neighbor's farm. The harvest owners share in the profit upon sale, which is divided 10/100 or depending upon their agreement. With a desire to earn more, Florina decided to buy a piece of land for farming and takes care of it on her own as well.
 
Through PMPC, Florina obtained the capital to finance her farming activities. Now, she requests a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for farm labor for transplanting (pulling of seedlings, fertilizer application and planting). She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. 

Someday, she wants to buy an additional piece of land for farming to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor for transplanting (pulling of seedlings, fertilizer application and planting).

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in Dban Calamba Misamis Occidental. Leonila has engaged in the snack vending business and selling various groceries. She has been in this business for 23 years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Leonila  requested a new loan to purchase stocks of raw goods for snack vending and additional groceries for her customers. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She believes that her business is good enough to sustain their needs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell and various groceries.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie lives in the village of La Libertad in Zamboanga del Norte along with her husband and four children. She helps her husband in managing their farm to earn a living. As an aid to her husband's income, she plants vegetables in her garden. A loan from GDMPC will help Margie to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her new plot of green leafy vegetables. She dreams of expanding her farm to gain stable income for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lustina

texts.en:
Lustina is 50, and married with six children. She lives in Colambutan, Settlement, Tudela, Philippines.

Lustina sells bananas and vegetables to earn a living, and has had this business for eight years. Lustina has been a member of PMPC for four years.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

In the future, Lustina hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, married, and a resident of Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through fsh selling.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 11 months, and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative.

Now she is applying a loan of Php 10,000 for additional capital to purchase 10 "banyeras" (big basin) of fish to sell.

Elizabeth deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is helping her husband manage their own farm to earn a living. She plants and harvests vegetables and sells them in the market; she has been doing this for more than five years. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seeds. 

Mary Ann is hopeful of generating greater returns to use for the family's needs in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seeds

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace lives with her family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Bushugunga/Chamagoti village in Senende, Kenya. She is 51 years old, works as a commercial farmer, and has 6 children aged 9 to 21 years old. The community of Bushugunga/Chamagoti village collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Bushugunga/Chamagoti’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Bushugunga/Chamagoti, 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Grace has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Hellen, Barnaba, John and Laban.

Bushugunga/Chamagoti village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Grace believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases, thus helping people to maintain good health and work without sickness. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Grace’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice, a a friendly, reliable and well-liked resident of Gimarakwa village, Kenya, has volunteered to be the community promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. 

Gimarakwa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Phanice and the 25 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Phanice has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. She volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help her community stay as healthy as possible by reducing diarrheal illness. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Joyce, Sagina, Japheth, and Zebedayo.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen lives in a home made of mud walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Maganda village in Mulundu, Kenya. She is 44 years old, makes her living as a subsistence peasant maize farmer, and has 5 children aged 15 to 22. The community of Maganda village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Maganda’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Maganda, 25 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Hellen has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Florence, Mary, Samson and Joash.

Maganda village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Hellen believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hellen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers.

Elizabeth dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina tem  44 anos de , é solteira e mãe de 03 filhos maiores todos frequentando o ensino técnico profissional.  Ela  vive na base de uma pensão e para conseguir pagar escola dos seus filhos, ela faz negócios.
Ela precisa do empréstimo para comprar barrotes para revender.
Ela gostaria de ver suas filhas formadas no ensino superior e casadas para além disso, ela gostaria de comprar uma camioneta para o transporte de barrotes de forma a facilitar o seu negócio.
O seu maior desafio é conseguir emprego para as suas filhas
texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old and single. She has three children, all of whom are adults and attend technical and vocational school. She lives from a pension and she does business so she can afford her children's schooling.
She needs the loan in order to purchase beams for re-selling.
She would like to see her daughters graduate from college and get married. Aside from that, she'd like to buy a pickup truck for carrying the beams, which would make her business easier.
Her biggest challenge is finding employment for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase beams.

loans.name: Key

texts.es: Key, de 24 años vive en compañía de su esposo Luis, aún no tiene hijos pero viven juntos en la casa de su madre donde nació. En un espacio que acondicionó en la tienda de su madre, Key empezó con la venta de productos de belleza, afirma que aún tiene un años dedicándose a este negocio y como cualquier comienzo es un poco difícil, “tengo clientes específicos que comprar mis productos, todavía no la cantidad que desearía pero poco a poco lo lograré”, comenta. Es así que día a día sale de casa a casa a ofrecer los productos. Ella es una mujer luchadora y logrará mejorar sus ingresos, tiene pensado comprar perfumes, pintaúñas, lápiz labial al por mayor para poder tener un stock y manejar los precios y por ende las ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el primer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Key, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de belleza para tener un stock.
texts.en: Key, 24, lives with her husband, Luis. They don't have children yet and they live in her mother's house where she was born. In an area she set up in her mother's store, Key started selling beauty products. She now has a few years of experience in this business and like any business at the be inning, it's a bit difficult. She comments, "I have specific clients who buy my products; still not as much as I would like but little by little I will make it." She sells door to door every day like this to offer her products. She is a hard-working woman and will achieve an increase in income. She's been thinking about buying perfumes, nail polish, and lip liner wholesale to stock up and be able to manage her prices and also her earnings. Key belongs to the "La brisas" communal bank and this is her first loan with Kiva. She is happy to continue working with the members of the communal bank, who are very supportive, welcoming, and responsible. Key will invest the money into buying beauty products so she has them in stock.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Beatriz

Beatriz tem 37 anos de idade,  casada e mãe de 07 ( sete)  filhos que estudam longe de sua casa.  
Ela  vende  mariscos ( camarão, lagosta e peixe) em restaurantes da sua provincia, e com os lucros ele paga escola dos seus filhos.
Com o empréstimo ela vai comprar peixe, lagosta, e lulas para revender. 
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar a sua casa e comprar mobίlia mas tem o desafio de aumentar o número de seus clientes

She sells shellfish (shrimp, lobster and fish) to restaurants of her province, and with the profits she pays for her children's school fees.
With the loan she'll purchase fish, lobster and squids for re-selling.
Her biggest dream is to enlarge her house and buy furniture. However, she faces the challenge of expanding her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase fish, lobster and squids.

texts.pt:
Florentino é casado, e pai de 5 filhos na sua responsabilidade,frenquentando o nivel primário, tem 46 anos de idade,, vive na casa própria, é militar há 28 anos, trabalha 9 horas diárias. 
Com o dinheiro vai comprar cimento, barrotes, porta,janela,para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa. 
No futuro espera ampliar a casa e continuar a estudar,e sempre fará empréstimo para realizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Florentino is married. He has five children who are under his responsibility and attend elementary school. He's 46 years old and lives in a house that he owns. He has been a serviceman for over 28 years and works nine hours a day.
With the loan he'll purchase cement, beams, a door and a window so he can continue building his house.
In the future he hopes to enlarge his house and keep on studying. He'll always apply for loans so he can achieve his plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, a door and a window.

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is 32 years old and has 5 children. She lives in Gamei village in Gamoi in Kenya. Gamei village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Mildred and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Mildred works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Mildred and other promoters in her community (including: Jessica, Joyce, Everlyne and Paulina) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Mildred will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and she will refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Mildred wants to be a promoter because she is happy to help her people access safe water and consult concerned people to help them. Mildred believes that the dispenser will help her community members prevent waterborne diseases that have been a problem to the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mildred’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en: Nelsie is married and the mother of two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, the Philippines where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by selling a variety of food and household items. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work and has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, iodized salt, sauce, canned goods, noodles, candies, beverages, detergents and soaps. Nelsie has been a member of PMPC for six years and hopes in the future to supplement her family's income and use part of her earnings to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.pt:
Gina é solteira,e mãe de uma criança recem nascida,vive na casa dos pais,tem 25 anos de idade, trabalha como técnica de recursos humanos, trabalha 8 horas diárias. 
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar varoes, cimento, blocos, areia para construir varanda da sua casa.
No futuro prentende comprar viatura para o transporte pesssoal e concluir a construçao da sua casa. 
Para lograr os seus intentos vai honrar com os rembolsos e solicitar mais empréstimo
texts.en:
Gina is single and the mother of a newborn child. She's 25 years old and lives with her parents. She works an 8-hour day as a human resources technician.
With the money from the loan she'll purchase rods, cement, bricks and sand so she can build a porch in her house.
In the future she intends to purchase a vehicle for personal transportation and to finish building her house.
In order to accomplish her goals, she'll abide by the repayment plan and apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase rods, cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio is a dairy farmer in the Tlaxcalan high plains. His family has been farming these lands as far as he can remember, and he hopes to continue the tradition as long as possible. Currently, the low price of milk and the increasing costs of propane, the most common source of domestic fuel, are both making it difficult for him to be profitable. 

He is investing in a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to convert the abundant cow waste on his farm into resources - a fuel source and a potent soil amendment. He and his family will use biogas to cook, using the stove included as part of the biodigester kit this loan helps pay for. 

This loan represents 50% of the total sales price of a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto  a su esposo y su menor hijo en la zona rural El Palmo Cayaltí, donde la población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.
Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida, Marilú  se  dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de  animales pequeños patos, gallinas y cuyes y ofrecerlos a un mejor costo, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marilú is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and her young son in rural El Palmo Cayaltí. The people there work in agriculture and the small animal trade. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo. It's located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.
They are a close family striving to have a better quality of life. Marilú raises and sells small animals. Her business is located in the back of her home. She has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small animals like ducks, chickens and guinea pigs and sell them at a good price. This will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: buy ducks, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en:
Mark lives in Sugura A village in Shiru, Kenya with his wife. The community of Sugura A village collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Sugura A’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Sugura A, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Mark has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Eunice, Elizabeth and Hellen.

Sugura A village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Mark believes that the chlorine kills germs in the water, which makes it safe to drink. He believes the dispenser will therefore prevent waterborne diseases and allow community members to have good health and be successful in life. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mark’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes lives in a home with mud walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Jidereria A village in Shiru, Kenya with her family, which includes 9 children. The community of Jidereria A village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Jidereria A’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Jidereria A, 40 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Agnes has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Patrick, Evans and Josphine.

Jidereria A village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Agnes believes that the dispenser will kill bugs and prevent waterborne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Agnes’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is managing her own business as an aid to her husband's income from employment. She has been selling different products in their community for more than five years to earn a living. 

Recently, Marilyn borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more cosmetics, soap and home use products for sale. She is hopeful to gain success from her business and be able to provide a better future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, soap and home use products for sale.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 49 years old and lives in Brgy Paiton, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Mercedita is vending vegetables and fruits. She has been engaged in this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits.

Mercedita has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost three years. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with three children. Elvie is 42 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Elvie sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, chocolates, orange juice, crackers, biscuits, breads, creamsticks, etc.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for six months.  In the future, Elvie hope to pay her children's tuition fees and to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, chocolates, and more

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 58 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y su hija en la zona rural de Zaña donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 15 años de dedica a la carpintería metálica, es reconocido por su labor en su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos (fierro, soldadora, pegamentos, oxigeno, otros) lo que le permitirá trabajar de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Samuel is 58 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the rural area of Zaña, where the population works in agriculture and trade of small animals, two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

For the past 15 years he has worked in metal fabrication. He is known for his work in the community, and he has requested this loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4,000 nuevo soles to buy spare parts (metal, soldering iron, adhesive, oxygen, and other items) which will allow him to work in a better way.

loans.use: to buy metal, adhesive, oxygen, and a soldering iron.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Lumipac Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Marites has been engaged in vegetable vending for more than six years earning a monthly income of PHP 15,000. She requested a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her own vegetable farm. Marites became a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC just this year and is satisfied with the services being offered by Paglaum. She hopes to have more savings for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her own vegetable farm

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Distrito de Oyotun una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene 02 mototaxis propias, la cual una lo maneja y la otra lo alquila y ha solicita un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para hacer arreglos en su mototaxi que alquila, carpa , llantas y compra de SOAT para la mototaxi nueva y de esta manera seguir trabajando sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Williams is 21 years old and lives with his parents in the Oyotun district. This community is heavily focused in agriculture and commerce, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo of the Lamayeque region along Peru's northern coast. 

Williams has two mototaxis of his own, one which he drives and the other which he rents out. He has requested this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to fix up the mototaxi that he rents out including a cover, tires and accident insurance so that he can continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase tires, cover and accident insurance.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 55 years old and a resident of Maralag, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children. She has been earning a living for 30 years from her farming business. Through this business, she has sent her children to school, continued to put bread on their table, and deposited savings to PMPC. She applied for her membership to Paglaum MPC in the year 2010. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. Emma applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for labor for her farming activities such as land preparation (plowing, leveling, cleaning of dikes/levees) and seedbed preparation (mounting of beds, seed sowing, maintenance). She has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of whom she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To pay for labor for preparing the land and the seedbed

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir is a 39-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1992, Nasir has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. He has a bicycle from which he sells milk at the main market and door to door.

Currently, he needs to purchase tanks to keep the milk. For this reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Previously he had only one tank and he need two more tanks to store the milk. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk containers for his milk selling business.

loans.name: Maria Ideliza

texts.es:
María Ideliza tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, un distrito conocido por los sembríos de arroz, maíz, algodón y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida y emprendedora muy conocida por su labor que realizan, desde hace 10 años María Idelsa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar productos de arroz, leche, cereales y así incrementar su bodega y ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes, de esta manera también generaran mayores ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Maria Ideliza is 56 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Oyotun, a district know for its fields of rice, corn, and cotton, and small animal trade. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

They are a close and enterprising family very well-known for the work that they do. For the last ten years Maria Ideliza has worked in the sale of groceries. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to buy rice, milk, and grains so that she can increase her store and offer a variety of products to her customers. That way she can also generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, grains, and rice.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, de 37 años, está felizmente casada con Edwin, ambos tienen 5 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, muy cómoda y bien situada a las afueras de la ciudad para la actividad que desempeña y que no le permitirían realizar en el centro de la ciudad.Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos Rita, junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos en un espacio amplió y cercano a donde viven, también de manera independiente ella, tiene un taller de pirotecnia donde elabora cohetecillos, y diferentes ilustraciones de animales y objetos que al encenderse produce chispas y luces de diferentes colores en las fiestas patronales que se desarrollan en esta parte de la selva central “La Merced”, por otro lado cuando su pareja no le ayuda, practica el oficio de músico que también le resulta rentable y hasta les permite ahorrar, para más adelante poder construir su casa propia en la ciudad y de esa manera instalar un restaurante, que le facilite un negocio menos peligroso, ella, lleva 15 años dedicada a estas labores y asegura que gracias a esta actividad a sus hijos nunca les faltó que comer. Pero los costos de los estudios de sus hijos son su primordial problema, pues invierte la mayor parte de sus ingresos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Rita, solicita S/.1300 con el cual comprará papel cometa, mechas, y cordeles, para realizar los materiales y animales pirotécnicos.
texts.en:
Rita is 37 years old and happy married to Edwin. They have five children and live in a house that is rented, very comfortable and well situated for their business on the outskirts of the city, as they wouldn't be able to have their business in the center of the city. In order to improve their children's well-being, Rita and her husband make a living by making bricks in a large space near where they live.

Independently, Rita also has a fireworks shop where she makes firecrackers and various illustrations of animals and objects that produce sparks and different-colored lights when they are lit during the traditional festivals in this part of the central jungle, “La Merced.” When her partner isn't helping her, she also works as a musician, which is also profitable and even allows them to save to be able to build their own house in the city. She will thus open a restaurant, which will allow her to have a less dangerous business. She has been doing this work for 15 years and asserts that thanks to this business her children have never gone hungry. But the costs of her children's studies are her biggest problem, as she invests the greater part of her earnings there.

She belongs to the “Las brisas” communal bank and this is their third loan with KIVA. She is happy to keep working with the members of her communal bank, who are very caring, welcoming and responsible people. Rita is asking for 1,300 Peruvian nuevos soles, with which she will buy kite paper, fuses and twine to make the firework materials and animals.

loans.use: to buy paper and fuses, among other items

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 34 years old. She is single and takes care of two members of her family. She has been in the business of selling firewood for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KSHS 18,000. She operates her business in Kokwet and is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. She has borrowed KSHS 15,000 and plans to use the loan to buy firewood to sell. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is 34 years old, married and provides for three members of her family. She has been in the clothes-selling business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KSHS 8,000. She operates her business in Kapsabet town and is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. She has borrowed KSHS 25,000 and plans to buy shirts, curtains, trousers and shorts to sell. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy shirts, curtains, trousers and shorts to sell

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 29 years old and married to Regina. They have two children who are yet to start school.

Caleb has a photography shop that he has been running for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to buy a camera. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a new camera

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old from the Engineer area of Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Ann and together they have two children who are four years old and four months old.

David is a farmer and sells potatoes. He has been in this business through the years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to buy more potatoes to add to his stock. He is planning to use the profits made to buy a piece of land.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Sr. Saúl tiene 55 años,  el tiene la actividad de transporte de pasajeros en la localidad de el Torno el es moto taxista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Saúl va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una  motocicleta  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Saúl va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos y si se puede otra motocicleta, El Sr. Saúl es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse, el deseo del Sr. Saúl es tener una tienda donde pueda vender motocicletas ya que esta es una nueva actividad en la que esta incursionado.
texts.en:
Saúl is 55 years old and works transporting passengers in the El Torno area. He is a motorcycle taxi driver. This loan is his first sequence in the institution. Saúl is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle and thus provide a better service to his customers and increase his earnings. His reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving his business. Saúl is going to use his earnings to keep buying replacement parts, and another motorcycle if he can. 

Saúl is a very hard-working person. He feels happy about the opportunity provided, as this is the only business that allows him to maintain himself. Saul's wish is to have a store where he can sell motorcycles, as this is a new business he is venturing into.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married. She does farming in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops and keeps dairy cattle. She also has a grocery business. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children. Her spouse produces additional income to support the family.

Elizabeth will be using this loan to buy another dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay college fees for her children.

This is her first loan and in the future, she hopes to grow her farming business and have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural que se dedica a los cultivos de arroz, yuca, maíz y comercio de animales menores. Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Hace 10 años María Elena se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar animales pequeños para posteriormente ofrecerlos a mejor precio y también la compra de alimentos balanceados que le permitirán tener una mejor producción y de esta manera tener ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 28 years old and lives with her two sons in the district of Oyotun, a rural area that works in the cultivation of rice, yucca, corn, and the trade of small animals. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

For the past ten years Maria Elena has worked in raising and selling animals. Her business is located at the back of her home, and she has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy small animals to later offer them at the best price. It is also to buy animal feed which will allow her to have better output and that way she can have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Delis

texts.es:
Delis tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el la zona rural de Yapana, distrito de Callayuc, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, café, cacao, maíz a dos horas de dedicado a la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El es un joven emprendedor desde hace 5 años se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente en el caserío de Yapana, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos para destinarlo a la compra de una área de plantación de caña la cual es materia prima para la destilación de aguardiente, con la compra tendrá mayor cantidad de caña esto le permitirá obtener mayor cantidad de botijas de aguardiente y generarle mayores ingresos para contribuir con su familia.
texts.en:
Delis is 23 years old. He lives in the rural zone of Yapana, in the district of Callayuc, where the residents cultivate sugar cane, coffee, cacao, and corn. It is two hours from the city of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He is a young entrepreneur. For five years he has worked distilling aguardiente [an alcoholic drink] in the village of Yapana. He has applied for a loan of 4000 PEN to use for the purchase of an area of a sugar cane plantation, which provides the basic material for the distillation of aguardiente. With the purchase he will have a greater quantity of cane, and this will allow him to obtain a greater quantity of bottles of aguardiente and generate more income to contribute to his family.

loans.use: to buy an area of a sugar cane plantation

loans.name: Henrry Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr. Henrry sigue con la misma actividad de la de fabricación de calzados,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cuerina y materiales, Cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en compra de cuero para realizar su trabajo, se siente agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que este prestamos le ayuda a mejora su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Henrry continues with the same business of making shoes. Now he is applying for a loan to buy imitation leather and materials. He relates that it went well for him with the previous loan, since he used it to purchase leather to do his work. He feels grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support offered, since this loan helps him to improve his business and as a result his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy imitation leather to make women's shoes

loans.name: Hizar

texts.en:
Mr. Hizar is a 22-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Hizar has been running his own clothing business, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 

He sells a variety of ladies’ and gents’ un-stitched clothes in the market. He is having old stock in his shop, due to which his numbers of customers and sales are decreasing day by day. Therefore, he wants to replace the old stock of his shop with a new one. For that, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new variety of ladies’ and gents’ clothing. This will help him to attract customers and to increase his sales and income. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of winter clothing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Catherine, and supports five members of his family. He runs a motorcycle business in the Chepkumia location served by KADET, Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the past two years.

From this business, Joseph gets a monthly income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to service his motorcycle and expand his business. With the anticipated profits, he will pay his children’s school fees and make loan repayments.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and expand his business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 40 years old and married to David. They have two children who are in school.

Rachael has a cereals business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to buy cereals like rice and beans to add to her stock.

She hopes to become the top cereal seller in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy cereals like rice and beans to add to sell

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира и ее семья живет в сельской местности, где местные жители в основном занимаются скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Мохира более 10 лет занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращиванием картошки. Она имеет свою землю. Мохира с бизнесом справляется сама. Ее муж работает учителем в средней школе. Он имеет высшее образование. Мохира и ее муж воспитывают 4 детей. Скоро ее сын жениться и она должна достроить дом для своего сына и его будущей жены. Мохира запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как кирпич, цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mohira and her family live in a rural area, where local residents mainly engage in raising livestock and agriculture. For more than ten years, Mohira has been involved in livestock and crops. She mainly grows potatoes. She has her own land. Mohira manages the business on her own. Her husband works as a high school teacher. He has a higher education. Mohira and her husband are raising four children. 

Soon, her son will get married and she must build a home for her son and his future wife. Mohira is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to purchase building materials like bricks, cement, wood, and the like.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, and wood for building a house

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам добрый и честный молодой человек. Он имеет конкретные цели в жизни и старается реализовать все свои планы в реальность. Рустам данное время является студентом 5 курса. Он учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана в факультете Мировая экономика. Рустам умный и начитанный студент. Он участвует в различный соревнованиях и старается расширить свой кругозор. В будущем мечтает сделать международную карьеру. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rustam is a good and honest young person. He has concrete goals in life and is trying to bring all his plans to reality. Rustam is currently in the 5th course. He is studying at the National University of Tajikistan in the department of World Economics. Rustam is a clever and well-read student. He participates in different competitions and is trying to expand his horizons. 

In the future, he dreams of making an international career. 

He is requesting a loan to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a forty-nine-year-old woman. She is married to Joseph, and they have four children. She does poultry farming and has been in this business for two years. She gets a monthly income of thirteen thousand shillings.

This is Hannah’s first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy feed for the poultry. In the future, she plans to expand her business so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a 49-year-old woman; she is married to Allan and a mother of six children. She sells second hand clothes in Muchatha in Kangemi. She has been in this business for two years and gets a monthly income of KES 9,500.

This is Eddah’s first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the future she plans to expand her business further so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Nidia Sthefany

texts.es: La Señorita Nidia tiene 27 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  técnico en informática,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios trabaja como atención al cliente en una empresa privada, lo cual le permite cubrir sus gastos su ingreso mensual mínimo que le ayuda a pagar sus estudios  este es su primer crédito que tiene  con la institución, Nidia va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo financiar los gastos de matriculación y la compra de material escolar para terminar sus estudio que durara el tiempo 2 años y medio, Nidia enfrenta retos en su estudios que son la falta de tiempo para cumplir sus obligaciones laborales, y las de sus estudios superiores,  vive en la zona  Unión de la  Ciudad de la Paz,  su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nidia is 27 years old and is single. She is studying for a technical degree in information technology. She works to pay for her studies; she works in customer service in a private company, which allows her to cover her expenses. Her minimal monthly income helps her pay for her studies. 

This is the first loan she has had with the institution. Nidia is going to use this loan for various expenses involved in studying, like financing her tuition costs and buying material for school to finish her studies, which will last for two and a half years. Nidia faces challenges in her studies, which are a lack of time to complete her work obligations and those of her higher studies.

Nidia lives in the Unión area of the city of La Paz. When she finishes her studies, she wants to work in her profession, and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to finance her tuition costs and to buy materials for school

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer who lives in Kitale. He is married and has four children. He has been involved in farming for five years. On his farm, he grows crops and rears a lot of poultry. His income comes from the sale of eggs and crops. Besides these, he also offers transport services. His major challenges in farming are drought and pests on poultry and crops, but he enjoys the output he gets out of his farming activities.

Robert said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer good deals on their loans. When asked what he learnt during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session, he said that MFIs (microfinance institutions) offer loan repayment options that are flexible.

This loan will enable him to buy a dairy cow, since he wants to expand his farm. This will bring in more income once the cow starts producing milk, and thus his family will have an improved livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento RETAMAS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. josefina  tiene 45 años,  con dos hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta  de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la zona de Tembladerani,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. josefina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un congelador grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne., la Sra. josefina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de carne  al por mayor, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The Retamas Communal Bank is composed of 9 members, 6 women and 3 men. The president of the bank is Josefina who is 45 years old and has 2 children. She sells meat in her butcher ship, located in the zone of Tembladerani. 

This loan will be her 1st within the institution. Josefina will use the loan to buy a large freezer for conserving her products in good condition. Her reason for soliciting the loan is that she needs the freezer to sell meat. 

Josefina confronts challenges in her business, including competition, since there are various butcher shops in the zone. But she has a lot of clientele due to the friendliness with which she treats her customers. Josefina will use future benefits to purchase more meat at wholesale. Her goal is to have a stable and profitable business and in this manner, to increase her economic income.

loans.use: buy a freezer.

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru:
Илхомидин молодой мужчина в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат имеет маленького сына. Его жена домохозяйка, занимается домашними делами и воспитанием сына. Конечно же в свободное время она помогает мужу. 
Сам Илхомиддин занимается откормом скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается с самого детства, так как его родители занимались этим бизнесом. Он знает все преимущество своего дела. Это единственный доход в семье поэтому Илхомиддин старается развивать этот бизнес.  
Сейчас его количество скотов уменьшился поэтому он хочет увеличить их. По совету знакомых Илхомиддин обратился в организацию Арванд чтобы получить кредит. На полученный кредит Илхомиддин планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье своего скота.
texts.en:
Ilhomiddin is a young man of 29 years. He is married and has a young son. His wife is a homemaker, engaged in domestic work and raising their son. Of course, in her free time she helps her husband. 

Ilhomiddin himself is involved in fattening cattle. He has been involved in this kind of work since childhood, since his parents were involved in this business.  He knows all the benefits of his trade. This is the only income for the family, therefore Ilhomiddin is trying to develop the business.
  
Now his count of cattle has decreased so he wants to increase them. On the advice of friends, Ilhomiddin turned to the organization Arvand in order to receive a loan. With the loan received, Ilhomiddin plans to buy cattle and to increase the headcount of his cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa is 60 years old and lives in the village of Pukhrut, which is in the Syunik region. He has no higher education, and for many years, he worked as a carpenter. Styopa is married and has a son and a daughter. His son is with his family, and lives and works in the Russian Federation, and his daughter is also married and with her family, and lives in Kapan city.

Styopa and his wife are engaged in farming. In their farm, they have four cows, a bull, and three calves. Their main farm products are milk and meat, which they sell at the city's wholesale market. In this way they earn their living, take care of their farm, and hardly manage to support their children’s families.

Styopa asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy a lot of hay for his farm cattle for winter period.

loans.use: to buy a lot of hay for his farm cattle for the winter period.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru: Махмудчон со своей семьей живет в районе Спитамен. Ему 37 лет. Он занимается скотоводством. Закупает маленьких бычков, откармливает в течение одного месяца и продает их с наценкой на скотном рынке. Махмудчон занимается данной деятельностью в течение 8 лет. В данный момент у Махмудчона на скотном дворе имеется одна дойная корова и теленок. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота, поэтому берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Mahmudjon lives with his family in the Spitamen region. He is 37 years old. He is involved in raising cattle. He buys young calves, fattens them over the course of one month and sells them with a margin at the livestock market. Mahmudjon has been involved in this activity over the course of eight years. 

Currently, Mahmudjon has in his livestock yard one dairy cow and a calf. He wants to increase his livestock count, so he is taking a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy young calves with the aim of fattening and resale

loans.name: Mirhakim

texts.ru: Мирхаким житель района Спитамен. Ему 34 года. У него есть жена, 17-летняя дочь и 19-летний сын. Мирхаким обеспечивает свою семью за счет животноводства. Вот уже 10 лет как он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На данный момент в скотном дворе Мирхакима имеется только одна дойная корова. Мирхаким запрашивает кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и планирует на деньги от кредита закупить пару голов бычков.
texts.en:
Mirhakim is a resident of the Spitamen region. He is 34 years old. He has a wife, 17-year-old daughter and 19-year-old son. Mirhakim provides for his family through raising cattle. It has been ten years already that he has been involved in fattening and selling cattle. Currently in his livestock yard, Mirhakim has only one dairy cow. 

Mirhakim is requesting a loan, in order to increase his livestock count and with the money from the loan plans to buy a pair of calves.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of calves for cattle raising

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir lives in Yerevan city with his small family. He is married and has a son and a daughter who is still school-aged. Vladimir’s wife has a specialty of architect, but at this moment, she does not work. Vladimir works at a very big company that produces mineral water, and he is a sales manager there.

Vladimir’s son is a very talented young man who has graduated Yerevan State Conservatoire, faculty of Folk Musical Instruments; he plays on reed pipe. He has taken part in many concerts and competitions, and won prizes of the first place. 

Now, he has some new plans and ideas. At this moment, he studies in the magistracy of Yerevan State University, at the paid division in a newly opened department of Mass Media Research and Education Center, faculty of Directing. This faculty cooperates with TV, and in the future, he will work there with his corresponding qualification.

Vladimir asks for a loan of 225,000 Armenian Drams in order to pay for his son’s tuition fees for a master's degree. He surely believes that in the future, his son will have great successes and good income from his work.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s tuition fee for a master degree.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of thirty nine years. He is married to Jane, and together they have five children. He is a fruit vendor, and has been in this business for five years. He gets a monthly income of nineteen thousand and fifty shillings.

This is Paul’s first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy variety of fruits for his business. In future, he plans to expand his business so he can educate his children.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 54 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. He is a tailor, and runs a tailoring shop in Kangundo town. He has been in this business for 15 years, and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to buy more materials for sewing. These include textile material, buttons, and sewing threads of different varieties. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to buy more tailoring materials.

This is his 5th loan term, and he paid all his previous loans successfully. His hope for the future is to improve his business and the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy textile materials, buttons, and threads for sewing.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah City, Gaza Strip, Palestine, and is a father of three young daughters.  Shadi is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income.  This in the only source of income for his family.  Shadi would like to improve his family's conditions and maybe in the future he would like to build a better home. 

Shadi took a Murabaha loan from the FATEN field partner.  This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home and will improve his family's living conditions, especially for his kids.  Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 38 years old and lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. Mher has studied at a technical college with the specialty of trade. Mher is married and has two sons. He lives with his wife, children, and mother. Mher’s wife does not work, and she takes care of their children; his mother works as a backer. 

It has already been ten years since Mher has his own business. He built a very nice and cute building, and he uses it as a café. It is a very popular place for both citizens of Kapan and tourists vising the city.

It is a very calm and nice place to have a meeting with friends, eat something tasty and original, and listen to nice music. In his business, Mher’s wife helps him very much.

Mher is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase colored lights equipment, some new utensils, and barbecue brazier, and build a tonir (a special Armenian oven; a construction which is built in land where the Armenian national bread, Lavash, is backed).

loans.use: to purchase colored lights equipment, new utensils, and barbecue brazier, and build a tonir (a special Armenian oven).

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara se ha dedicado al café desde hace más de 10 años al lado de su esposo, que fué quien le enseñó todo lo necesario de este negocio. Cuando no es cosecha ella se encarga de las labores del hogar sin embargo las plantas ya comienzan a dar sus primeros frutos asi que es hora de ir a trabajar al campo. Ella solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para el pago de cortadores de café que contratará. Además de producir café Clara y su esposo también se dedican a la producción de limón para así tener otro ingreso para la familia.
texts.en:
Clara and her husband have earned their living growing coffee for more than ten years. Her husband taught her all about the coffee business. When it is not harvest time, Clara occupies herself with household chores.

However, the plants have already started to bear their first beans and so it is now time to work in the fields. Clara is seeking a loan to pay for contract workers. 

As well as growing coffee, Clara and her husband grow lemons in order to have another source of income for the family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to help harvest coffee

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for three sons and two daughters. Ayman is an employee at a local company where he gets a low and unstable income. This in the only source of income for the family. Ayman would like to improve the family conditions. He would like to improve his home and buy all the needed stuff in the future.

Ayman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family's living conditions, especially for his kids.
 
Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 26-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. For the past three years, Basel has been working in a library he owns. He sells stationery and other office supplies. He also helps university students in writing research and printing it. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Basel has taken a US dollar loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his library to resell. This will improve the library conditions and also increase his income. 

Basel appears in the photo in his library.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 25 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su pequeño hijo en la casa que compró hace algunos años.Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para el progreso de su familia. Es así que ahora tiene un propio negocio; la venta de comida por pensión a los diversos comercios de la ciudad, su trabajo comienza en la mañana cuando desde las primeras horas del día sale a comprar al mercado de la ciudad los insumos que necesitará para la preparación de los alimentos. Una vez realizadas las comprar ella prepara el plato del día ya a medio día se alista pata llevar a sus clientes el rico almuerzo. Le va muy bien en su negocio pues cada día tiene más clientela que compra los exquisitos platos que ella prepara. Es por eso que ahora desea mejorar su sazón mucho más.   Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el primer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Flor, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y aceite al por mayor para la preparación de los alimentos.
texts.en:
Flor, who is 25 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and her little son in the house that she bought several years ago. When she was very young, she began to work for the progress of her family. Thus she now has her own business: selling pre-ordered meals to the various businesses in the city. Her work begins in the morning, when, at the first hours of the day, she goes out to the city market to buy the supplies that she will need for the preparation of her food. Once she has made her purchases, she prepares the dish of the day, since at midday she is ready to take her customers their delicious lunch. It is going very well for her in her business, since every day she has more customers who buy the exquisite plates that she prepares. It is for this reason that now she wants to improve her cooking much more. 

She belongs to the communal bank "La Brisas," and this is her first loan with Kiva. She is happy to continue working with the members of her communal bank, who are very united, welcoming, and responsible. Flor will invest the 1000 PEN in the wholesale purchase of supplies such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, and oil to prepare her foods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, and pasta, among other items.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is a 24-year-old man. He is a hardworking man living in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a taxi driver. It has been a profitable business and the only source of income for the family. He is requesting a loan from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for his taxi. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours, and enable him to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: to help him cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two young sons. Ahmad is an employee at a local company where he gets a low and unstable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad would like to improve the family conditions. He would like to improve his home and buy all the needed stuff in the future.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family living conditions, especially for his kids. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two young daughters. Mohammad is an employee at a local company where he gets a low and unstable income. This in the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad would like to improve the family's conditions. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family's living conditions, especially for his kids.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two young sons. Murad is a worker in the construction field where he gets a low and unstable income. This in the only source of income for the family. Murad would like to improve the family conditions.
 
Murad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family's living conditions, especially for his kids.
 
Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but does not have piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothing shop, selling clothes for both men and women.  She cites stiff competition as her major business challenge.

Emily is requesting for 30,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Meet James, a farmer who hails from Kitale, an area known for its vast maize production. He has been involved in farming for four years. On his farm he has cows and poultry and grows crops, especially maize. His main source of income is the sale of milk, eggs, and crops, and he also has a personal business. He enjoys the good returns he gets out of farming, while his biggest challenges are the diseases that affect the crops and livestock.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their low interest rate. When asked what he learned from Juhudi's microfinance training session, he said that saving is very important and microfinance institutions give you an opportunity to do that. This loan will help him purchase more poultry and thus generate more eggs and more income. This will give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal was born in 1988. She lives with her husband in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. Her husband is in the military. Amal has been selling clothes for one year. She started her project with a small quantity of them and found it a good source of income. Now she wants to increase the amount of clothes she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her husband. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma was born in 1977. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband works in decorative arts. Basma has been selling women clothes for 2 years. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. One of the obstacles she faced is the clothes' seasonal fluctuations.
